channel.title: Aviation - Digg
channel.description: Aviation on Digg: the best articles, videos, tweets, and original content that the web is talking about right now

item.title: How Should Airlines Change Post-Pandemic?
item.description: Let's think big: how would you create the ideal flying experience? What drives you crazy about flying and what do you never want to deal with again?

item.title: Small Plane Makes An Incredibly Precise Landing In The Middle Of A Busy Highway
item.description: We've seen small planes make emergency highway landings before, but never seen one land so close to moving cars.

item.title: A Flight Simulator Flies Some Of The World's Ugliest Planes
item.description: A YouTuber test flies some of the weirdest looking planes ever designed.

item.title: Passenger's Bag Hangs On For Dear Life After Pilot Fails To Secure Latch
item.description: "Pilot did not correctly close the latch and after take off. We had to turn around and secure the luggage before departing again!"
item.kicker: SO THAT'S WHERE OUR BAG WENT...

item.title: Remembering The Time United Airlines Offered A Men-Only Flight
item.description: From 1953 through 1970, United offered men-only 'Executive flights' — something you might see on an episode of "Mad Men."

item.title: Man Shows Off His Remarkably Realistic Home Built Flight Simulator
item.description: The whole setup costs around $7,000, but hey, it's cheaper than buying a plane.

item.title: Airport Aerials: The Incredible Photo Project Looking Down On Airports
item.description: One of photographer Toby Harriman's personal projects over the past few years has been exploring the unique designs of different airports, and his slowly expanding Airport Aerials project is offering truly unique perspectives on these massive spaces.

item.title: This Man Owns The World's Most Advanced Private Air Force After Buying 46 F/A-18 Hornets
item.description: We talked to the owner of Air USA about probably the most incredible private aircraft purchase of all time and the future of his adversary business.

item.title: The Boeing 737 Max's Big Problem? Its Computers Have The Processing Power Of A Super Nintendo
item.description: While Boeing has received plenty of scrutiny for its bad code, it's the Max's computing power — or lack thereof — that has kept it on the ground since then.

item.title: Here's Why So Many Planes Are Still Flying, Nearly Empty
item.description: Coronavirus-prompted schedule reductions haven't lined up with the drop in demand, as obstacles like logistics, DOT obligations, and algae get in the way.

item.title: Boeing 787s Must Be Turned Off And On Every 51 Days To Prevent 'Misleading Data' Being Shown To Pilots
item.description: US air safety bods call it "potentially catastrophic" if reboot directive not implemented.

item.title: A Virtual Demonstration Of Why Pilots Hate Landing At The Georgetown Municipal Airport
item.description: YouTuber Swiss001 shows why Georgetown Municipal Airport is an exceedingly difficult landing for a large aircraft.

item.title: Man Creates A Glider Airplane That Flies 'Infinitely'
item.description: Thanks to the ingenious design of the airplane, you can technically fly the airplane infinitely as long as you're behind to guide it.

item.title: The Technical Challenges Of Flying Near-Empty Planes
item.description: Revenue aside, flying empty or near-empty planes requires operational changes due to physics. It's all because of weight and balance.

item.title: The World's Largest Airplane Flies Again
item.description: Aviation enthusiasts, rejoice: After a long overhaul, Antonov's big bird, the AN-225, has finally returned.

item.title: When Secret Mystery Planes Landed At The Air Bases Where I Was Stationed
item.description: It may sound like fiction, but on rare occasions, ordinary air bases have extraordinary mystery visitors. It happened to me, twice.

item.title: Flight Operations Crew Demonstrate How They Keep Jets From Falling Off A Aircraft Carrier
item.description: These flight ops give specific directions to pilots using their hands.
item.kicker: TEAM WORK MAKES THE DREAM WORK

item.title: A Photographer's Surreal Flight Home During The COVID-19 Pandemic
item.description: Photojournalist Sharon Pulwer experienced some far-from-routine sights when she flew from Newark Airport to her family in Tel Aviv with El Al airline.

item.title: How The Coronavirus Has Been A Nightmare For The Aviation Industry
item.description: How the coronavirus outbreak has been catastrophic for air travel business.

item.title: All Flights To New York-Area Airports Halted
item.description: The FAA halted all flights to New York-area airports Saturday afternoon due to "staffing issues" at the New York air route traffic control center.

item.title: The Massive Decline In Worldwide Flight Capacity Due To Coronavirus, Visualized
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic has upended everyday life around the world — one of the most stark changes has been in air travel. This infographic from Visual Capitalist demonstrates how much the health scare has impacted flight capacity.

item.title: To Beat COVID-19, Think Like A Fighter Pilot
item.description: How an aerial-combat theory can help fight the outbreak.

item.title: Don't Give The Airlines What They Want
item.description: US airlines have spent the last decade shoveling billions in profits to stockholders. Now they want your tax dollars with no strings attached. Fuck that.
item.kicker: BAIL OUT THE RIGHT PEOPLE THIS TIME

item.title: How To Build Your Own Airplane — From Cockpit To Parachute
item.description: "It takes about 1,500 hours. You're trading time for money."

item.title: What It's Like To Be A Flight Attendant During The Coronavirus Pandemic
item.description: "It's a little surreal to wrap my brain around the past week."

item.title: I Was A Passenger On One Of KLM 747's Last Flights
item.description: We weren't supposed to be on that flight. We weren't supposed to be leaving that day or from that city, on that airline or on that plane.

item.title: This Experimental Drone Could Change America's War Strategy
item.description: This could be the future of combat aircraft.

item.title: Virus Creates World's Longest Passenger Flight
item.description: The aviation industry has been hit hard by the coronavirus pandemic, with travelers across the world dealing with canceled flights and travel bans as they scramble to get home. But one unlikely aviation side effect is the creation of a new world aviation record.

item.title: Why Should We Give The Airlines A Bailout?
item.description: They made a fortune over the past decade. Now they're demanding $50 billion to stay in business.

item.title: Watch A F-22 Raptor Perform Crazy Maneuvers In The Air With Incredible Agility
item.description: There's normal flying, and then there's magic like this.

item.title: An Architect Shows How The Worst Airport In America Can Radically Improve
item.description: Peter Ruggiero demonstrates what can be done to vastly improve traveler experience at Laguardia Airport in New York City.

item.title: How The Boeing 737 MAX Fiasco Was A Case Study In How Not To Handle A Crisis
item.description: The Wall Street Journal takes a deep dive on how Boeing botched the PR response to the scandal surrounding the safety of the 737 MAX.

item.title: The Risky First Transatlantic Flight Of A Reaper Drone
item.description: The Royal Air Force delayed safety warnings about the first transatlantic flight of a new Reaper aircraft in 2018, over fears that they could tip anti-drone protestors to its arrival in the UK.

item.title: This Footage An Aircraft Carrier Flyover From A Helicopter Looks (And Sounds) Spectacular
item.description: The only thing better than a flyover? A fly-under (that's what we're going to be calling this).

item.title: Experimental Plane Crashes On Landing, Misses Bystander By Inches
item.description: Luckily, both passengers in the experiment Questair M-20 Venture plane survived — as did the very lucky man by the golf cart.

item.title: Airlines Are Burning Thousands Of Gallons Of Fuel Flying Empty 'Ghost' Planes So They Can Keep Their Flight Slots During The Coronavirus Outbreak
item.description: Demand for flights has collapsed around the globe amid growing fears about the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: Archival Footage Of The Time NASA Crashed A Jetliner Filled With Fuel Into The Desert
item.description: Back in 1984, NASA and the Federal Aviation Administration conducted a controlled impact demonstration, intentionally crashing a Boeing 720 into the Mojave Desert to test technologies that would help passengers and crew survive.

item.title: United Cutting US Flights Because Of Coronavirus
item.description: United Airlines became the first airline to cut its US flight schedule on Wednesday, as passenger worry about the coronavirus has caused a sharp drop in demand.
item.kicker: AXING UP TO 10% OF DOMESTIC FLIGHTS

item.title: Plane Contrails Have A Surprising Effect On Global Warming
item.description: The wispy ice clouds formed by jet exhaust help trap heat near the Earth's surface. But small changes in altitude can dampen the effect, a study says.

item.title: How Air Travel And Health Care Got Great For The Wealthy And Worse For Everyone Else
item.description: "The Velvet Rope Economy" covers everything from theme parks to higher ed and explains why they became so much better for the rich — and so much worse for the rest of us.

item.title: How Christina Koch Could Become A Spaceflight Legend
item.description: One of the astronauts in NASA's current corps could be the first in a generation to walk on the moon — or the first to walk on Mars.

item.title: This Slow Motion, Super-Zoom 4K Footage Of An Airshow Is Just Spectacular
item.description: YouTuber Warped Perception took his fancy camera to an airshow and captured some gorgeous stuff.

item.title: How Would The World's Largest Planes Perform On The World's Shortest Runway?
item.description: An aviation hobbyist produced a simulation of how the largest commercially produced planes would do if they landed on the airstrip at Juancho E. Yrausquin Airport.

item.title: Giant Remote Control Boeing 747 Breaks Apart In Mid-Air, Crashes
item.description: It's all fun and games with your custom-built RC 747 until it plummets into a cow pasture.

item.title: The Dark Side Of The Flight Attendant Lifestyle
item.description: The high-flying lifestyle can come with a side of abject lows, including poor mental health, sleep disorders and substance abuse issues.

item.title: How Boeing Is Planning On Getting The 737 MAX Back In The Air
item.description: Boeing grounded its 737 MAX fleet after faulty sensors caused the aircraft to nosedive. Here's how the company is planning on turning things around in 2020.

item.title: Air New Zealand Unveils Comfy-Looking Sleeping Pods For Economy-Class Passengers
item.description: The airline announced it is introducing an Economy Skynest, which transforms seats into beds.

item.title: Man Designs A Model Of The Ekranoplan, The Russian 'Sea Skimmer' Plane, Tests To See If He Can Actually Fly It
item.description: When the words "Yeet" are painted over the plane, you know how this is going to go.

item.title: Why You Should Never Sleep During Take-Off Or Landing On A Plane
item.description: Why you can actually put your health at risk by sleeping through take-off and/or landing.

item.title: 13,000 Missing Flights: The Global Consequences Of The Coronavirus
item.description: The disappearance of thousands of flights from China's skies in recent weeks points to how the coronavirus has hobbled a nation and is posing a threat to the global economy.
